description:
Parley of Pirates is a pirate-themed game where the goal is to obtain the most booty (treasure). Players take turns playing different cards to either obtain booty or thwart other players' attempts. Play continues in rounds until all of the booty from the communal pile is exhausted. The player with the most booty at the end of the game is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher

Time Guardian Adventures - cooperative 3D puzzle adventures inspired by escape games. The new dimension of riddles and puzzles!
The eccentric criminal “Dr. Maxwell Mayhem" repeatedly manipulates the past to carry out his megalomaniac plans and change the present for his own benefit. It's up to you, the Time Guardians, to travel back in time to right Mayhem's evil deeds and restore the true course of history! The world is counting on you!
In this 3D adventure, Dr. Maxwell Mayhem went back in time and prevented the Maya from discovering chocolate over 3000 years ago! He stole their first cocoa tree, has claimed the precious beans for himself ever since and now hoards all the chocolate supplies in the world in his private vault.

—description from the publisher

The players try to reach the cathedral with their 2 players. In doing so, they must cross bridges that are constantly collapsing and being rebuilt. On the event card fields you can get help, but sometimes obstacles are put in your way.

Be creative and discover as many hidden words as possible in the images!

In this game, players must challenge themselves to find words and concepts in the displayed images, starting from a given category.

Whoever finds more words that the others have not found, adds points.

Repeated words between players are crossed out... so being original is a plus in this game (and in life),

In Elawa, you have to assemble your prehistoric tribe while collecting the elements necessary for its development, but the opposing chiefs will do you no favors, and your choices around the campfire are already full of dilemmas...

Each turn, pick one card from those surrounding the campfire on the table, add it to your tribe face up, and get a resources from the central display based on the number in the lower right of the card. Take these resources in order from where you picked up the card, getting a bonus if you take the last resource from a stack, after which the resource is re-filled. With these resources, you can build cards from your hand, whether for an immediate effect, resource storage, or endgame scoring.

When the central resource pile is empty, players tally their scores.

Road to fame is not a bed of roses. It is rather a bed of thorns and bumps. At the end of the road there is success (or not). Whether you are a rock musician or jazz band member, you want to play in the largest concert halls. Take this journey - from your parents' garage to the World Tour and be the most successful band.

What is Roll and Rock?

In Roll and Rock players take control over their own music band. The bands gain experience, improve their skill and equipment, hire new staff members, record albums, and give concerts. All of this brings you fame points.

Roll and Rock is a roll & write game. Using dice, players perform actions in the locations available. The game lasts 6 rounds. Players receive points for the concerts and records they made.  The player with the most fame points after the last round is the winner.

Humanity is a game of anticipation, very close to our future (in 2073). In this tile-and-worker placement game, 2-4 players have to manage resources and their time to build a base that will be used by scientific civilian settlers. Players have to assemble the modules produced by the automated station, too, and carry out experiments to further research.

On a turn, you can choose to produce resources or spend them by sending one of your three astronauts to the automated station to get new base modules or carry out experiments to further research. But time is a tool that must be managed as well; the further you go to get a specific module, the later you will get back to your scientific base to connect it...

—description from the publisher

Go on tour with your favorite rock band, KISS!  Help The Demon, The Spaceman, The Starchild, and the Catman, as they travel across the USA.

Put on the best shows, collect tons of cash, and bring Rock and mayhem everywhere you go.  First player to hold a concert in each city on this cross-country tour wins!

Will you become a Rock Legend?

—description from publisher

The Quest Kids: Giant Adventure is a LIFE-SIZED fantasy game experience for kids.

Using 36 giant cardboard tiles players will create a dungeon in their own home and act as the game pieces as they search for treasure, silly bad guys and stars.

Giant Adventure features the same award-winning mechanics as The Quest Kids board game, but in a new one-of-a-kind immersive experience.

—description from the publisher

The battle of Fleurus was fought during the so-called Bohemian phase of the Thirty Years War, but the battle occurred in the Flanders, fought between a Catholic Spanish army under the command of Gonzalo de Cordoba and a Protestant Protestant army led by mercenary leaders Mansfeld and Christian of Brunswick. The battle of Fleurus was initiated by a call from the Protestant Dutch to relieve the city of Breda, then under siege by another Spanish army under the command of Ambrogio Spinola. The aim of the Protestant troops was to cut off the retreat and trap the Spaniards, not just to end the siege.

The Protestant army encountered their opponents near Fleurus, and a furious battle ensued, where the better led (even if weaker) Spanish army was able to crush their Protestant enemy and provide a means of retreat for Spinola’s force.

Each combat unit represents from 300 to 1000 soldiers, and it is rated, from left to right, for combat factor, morale factor and movement factor. Each infantry strength point is around 150 men, each cavalry strength point around 60 men. Each leader is rated for Command (indicating how many activation chits that leader has) and Movement. Each hex is about 100 meters. Each turn represents a half hour of time.

Players draw leader markers from an opaque container (mug, envelope) to activate their leaders' formations. Units move about a hex map of the battlefield and use a six-sided die to resolve combat.

—description from the publisher

Cryptic is a card-based table-top RPG that takes up to 6 heroes across a new world plagued with the undead.

It is up to six worthy heroes to slice and dice their way through Inferis, vanquishing monsters, ridding the world of evil whilst levelling up, collecting unique loot, and crafting useful items.

Be warned through, The Legion is the least of your concern.

Grab a shield, sharpen your blade, and drink those potions! You've got a whole world full of adventure ahead of you.

The Isle of Inferis awaits.

—description from the designer

A six-volume set of children’s card games, based on popular Walt Disney films of the 1930’s & 1940’s.

The set includes:

Volume 1 - “Donald Duck Game” 
Volume 2 - “Pinocchio Game”
Volume 3 - “Mickey Mouse Game”
Volume 4 - “Bambi Game”
Volume 5 - “The Three Little Pigs Game”
Volume 6 - “Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs Game”

All games come in small match boxes, which fit in a case. The case has holes cut in its sides, so players can see its contents.

Join a group of fellow adventurers investigating a series of alarming disappearances in Icewind Dale in this single-play D&D escape board game for 2-6 players.

This harrowing 3-part adventure can be broken into 3 game sessions or played in 1 heroic sitting. Begin by creating your character. Then explore a humble tavern, fight in epic battles against iconic D&D monsters, and embark on a wild chase through the Underdark on the tail of an evil mage and his dangerous cult to unravel the mystery of their dastardly plans.

The only way to find the missing people and escape the obstacles is to explore rooms, complete puzzles, and gather clues to solve the mystery at the end of each act.

Mad Barons, Chinese Warlords, Revolutionary hordes, Archaic Imperialists and Fascist interventionists- your choice is endless. Skirmish rules for any Interwar theatre, but especially the madness that is the Back of Beyond. 5-6 units a side plus armoured cars etc if you fancy. Inc 6 Scenarios.

Night at the Ossuary is an 18 card, 2 player trick-taking game that implements some unique mechanisms and takes roughly 15 minutes to play.
You are archaeologists exploring the depths of a newly discovered ossuary, attempting to find the most valuable artifacts inside.

Players play out four hands in an attempt to score the most points to win the game.
In each game players will want to consider leveraging some of the unique mechanisms in this game:

     Playing multiple cards to a trick
     Emptying your hand first to score all the remaining cards in your opponent's hand
     Take zero tricks to score all the points your opponent would have scored this hand
     Pressing your luck based on the two unknown cards that weren't dealt this hand


—description from the designer

In Natera: New Beginning, you play as a sentient and intelligent animal tribe, exploring and controlling areas abandoned in a bright, post-humanity world.

With the help of your unique tribe leader and your explorers, you will explore, build authority, and take control of four distinct areas. Doing so will unlock new, more powerful tiles and allow you to establish settlements to further cement your presence. Improvements with human science will unlock powerful bonuses on a tech tree. Collecting the most venture points after four seasons will prove you are the animal tribe that adapted the best to the new Natural Era.

The game includes 150+ basic and advanced exploration cards featuring discoveries, improvements, science, and forty unique specialist cards, allowing each animal tribe to navigate and explore different strategies every single game.

—description from the designer

Players are contestants on a barbecue cooking reality show. Assign your assistants to various work stations to prepare the best feast by the end of four rounds.

A worker placement game with dice for workers. You roll your dice at the beginning of each round, and most worker placement spaces let you manipulate the values of your unplaced dice. You need to tune your workers correctly to perfectly cook your meat.

Score points for perfectly cooked meat and special sets of dishes at the end of the game.

Hametsu is a solo / co-op (1-4) monster hunting game set in post-apocalyptic feudal Japan. You take on the role of Hunters, warriors trained to fight back against a tide of Oni demons and mythical creatures let loose by The Cataclysm.

Each game of Hametsu sees the Hunters seeking out a mythical beast known as a Boss, and attempting to take it down. At the beginning of the game, the Hunters will be in stealth and wandering Oni will not be aware of their presence. Once the alarm has been raised, the Oni will pursue and target the Hunters until the Boss is found. Then it's up to the Hunters to be the last ones standing.

Hametsu uses standard d6’s for performing tests and saves. Hunters all have stats that govern how many d6 are rolled to perform certain actions. A roll of 4+ is a success. Score enough of those, and you will cast a spell, deal damage, or shrug off a hit.

Carve Your Own Path

Create a Hunter and choose from nine different classes spread among three different schools, all with unique abilities, spells, and playstyles. As you level up, choose new abilities and stats based on your class specific Path of Legend.

Narrative campaign

Hametsu encourages players to track progress from game to game, growing their Hunters and expanding their narrative story. Designed from the ground up for campaign play, dive in to randomly generated scenarios, or fight through the first narrative campaign, The Wolf and the Devil.

Stranger Tales is a role-playing game (RPG) and Board Game in which we will play the role of kids who will have to face the “Evil”. We are in the 1980s, an era that you probably experienced directly or indirectly through films, music, board games, videogames and everything that that unique and unrepeatable decade has left thanks to the echo of a time near and far. Did you know that the 80s were full of monsters and creatures of all kinds? If your answer is no, you probably did not directly experience that era or you have been told that it was just rumors; but if you lived it, if you were a child or a kid during those years, you know what I'm talking about. Monsters existed and walked around on their own legs. Of course, adults would never have believed you, but I can guarantee you that at that time Evil had eyes and legs, mouths and teeth.

The peculiarity of Stranger Tales is that you will have everything ready in one box: Just take it with you to experience fantastic adventures and you won't need anything else! Everything is in the box. Stranger Tales is also a mammoth work on ’80s and ’90s Pop Culture. In fact, in the definitive manual, you will find not only the rules to play but also contents that will help you identify yourself again—or for the first time—in a world so near and far.

The Fusion System that was born in Tales of Evil and continued in Boogeyman here evolves to the highest levels. It will only be your imagination and what you find in the stories that set the limits; but in reality, there is no limit whatsoever. You will be able to integrate into the game any action or behavior you wish in order to help your Investigators during your adventure. You may even be able to foresee that some Tests could take place outside of the usual game session, such as challenging players with special tasks to complete “side quests” in their real life.  For example, nothing prevents you from requesting a certain type of flower or object be brought the next time you get together to play, or performing real actions such as going to a place and hiding something there and then asking the other players to find the object that you have hidden before your next game session. As you can see, the limits to what you can create with the Fusion System are practically infinite. Don't like the Fusion System? Don't love taking actions in your real life to directly influence the game? No problem. In agreement with the other players, you can safely decide not to use the Fusion System for your games. The beauty of Stranger Tales is precisely this—that is to say, being able to adapt the game to your liking and in your image and likeness. Again, there is no limit.

—description from the publisher

That game aims to arouse children's curiosity about the history of Ä°stanbul, where they live or visit, and encourage them to research and learn. There are 60 questions in total in the game consisting of 30 cards.

How to play?

     All cards are shuffled
     The youngest player answers first. The player to her/his left draws the top card and asks one of the questions on the card.
     If the player answers true he/she takes the card. If the answer is false, the card is put below the deck. The game continues clockwise.
     If a player takes 4 cards of the same type, that player is the winner.


Short Game:

     If a player takes 4 cards of any type, that player is the winner.


Long Game:

     If a player takes all cards of the same type, that player is the winner.


—user summary

The object of the game is not to take cards. Horseshoes on each card you take will give you negative points. The winner of the game is the one who collects the fewest horseshoes at the end of the game.

Setup:


     Each player takes 10 cards from the deck
     Take 4 cards from the deck and place them under each other on the table.


How to play:


     Players place a card from their hand face down in front of them.
     After the last player has laid his/her card, all the cards are revealed simultaneously.
     Players place their cards according to the rules


Rules:


     Card which has a lower number first plays: The order of play is from the player with the lowest card to the player with the biggest card.
     Increasing Numbers: The cards must appear in ascending order in the row on the floor.
     Smallest difference: Each card must be played where the most minor difference is.
     The row which has been full: If there are 4 cards in a row that row is called as full. If a player must play a card to here that player takes all cards in that row and his/her card becomes the first card for that row.
     Choose what you want: If a player's card doesn't match with any of the rows that player takes any one of the rows and her/his card becomes the first card for that row.


—user summary

The Railroad Ink Challenge – Ultimate Collector’s Edition is finally here! With both Classic and Challenge Core games, expansions, and additional materials it has really everything you need and may desire to reach networking nirvana!

—description from the publisher

Penny Dreadfuls were short illustrated periodicals, very popular in the United Kingdom in the second half of the nineteenth century. 
They were very cheap booklets, costing just one copper penny and offering short stories with vivid and popular themes narrated with an emphatic and sensationalist style. 
Despite the low cultural value, Penny Dreadfuls gave birth to a genre that has constantly evolved to this day.

In Penny Dreadfuls of Victorian London: Sensational Tales of Terror, 1 to 5 players will share bizarre and frightening tales masterfully narrated by our authors, set in gloomy Victorian London in the late 19th century, infamous for the mysterious serial murders in the neighborhoods of Whitechapel and Whitehall.

In each Sensational Tale, specific Characters living in an ordinary Victorian world are suddenly embroiled in shocking events that catapult them out of reality and natural conventions. By joining them, players face a bizarre scenario, investigating, making deductions and choices,
facing trials leading to unpleasant consequences or handsome rewards.

Each game has a variable number of turns with different possible outcomes, ranging from miserable failure to utter and satisfying success, all depending on how the players interpret the story, sharing the fate of their Stars.

—description from the publisher

In this 2-player "search and write" game, you are a soldier conducting reconnaissance to map out your enemy's base. Gather intel one square at a time and use logic to complete the map before your enemy does. Power up your jammer at the right times to slow them down!

Recon Mission's gameplay is a cross between Battleship and Minesweeper, with a defensive element of jamming signals. At the start of the game, players draw six different structures on their own base map. Then they take turns calling out squares on the enemy map. The other player indicates whether this square is confirmed as part of a structure, a number from 0-8 indicating how many surrounding squares are part of a structure, or "jammed" (meaning they don't want you to know).

—description from the publisher

The Bible has 66 books, and each book a theme that God wishes to share with his people.

Bible it is a fun family game for 2-5 players where you will explore and learn about the various books in the Bible as scholars who are competing with each other to score points through various tokens.

Exploring these books and finding the right ones to bind together in its biblical order of course is your number one priority. Earn points when you do this and sometimes bonuses too. Race to collect the most points. And that's how you win at Bible-it.

—description from the publisher

Word Garden is a competitive word-building card game for 1-4 players. You and your friends live in a neighborhood where nothing is more important than having the nicest garden on the block. Players build three gardens using stacks of clear cards, forming as many words as possible in their completed gardens. Play your cards right, and you'll earn the title of Master Gardener!

Play centers around two decks of double-sided acrylic cards, each containing a pattern of letter-covered plants. Players simultaneously choose one of four cards from their hand to plant in their gardens. The remaining cards are then passed left and a new card is drawn from the deck. This process is repeated for a total of 12 rounds, with each player forming three gardens of 4 cards each by stacking them on top of each other.

Each completed garden contains 16 plants that form a 4 x 4 letter grid. Points are scored from words formed within the grid as well as from personal and shared goals. The player who scores the most total points wins the game.

A Solo Mode is also included with three levels of AI difficulty. Play occurs similarly except that, rather than being passed, unused cards are assembled into gardens for the AI, whose goals are revealed over time. Score more points than the AI to win the game.

—description from the designer

Players run a restaurant from welcoming the clients to adding the ingredients on the pizzas, while doing the accounting and service. The game only lasts a few minutes but it's total chaos.
Pizza Rush is a real time cooperative game published in France.

Hull and Aki They are a childhood favorite that grows like a sister.
Two visited the campsite in the back of the mountains, get caught in an unexpected case.
The dead body of the administrator was found.
Deep and closed environment 5 guest
The legend of cherry blossom trees and the mystery rope hung on branches.
And there are many information that has been rewritten.
Can the two people get to the truth?

Players start with a small number of Galactic Credits, a Corporate Headquarters and a small facility.  Since space is a very large place, on your turn you roll dice to determine the area of space players will focus their attention this turn.  As the Active Player you have numerous options including activating factories, building new factories, hiring employees, or even affect the conditions for victory.  When you’re done, other players in clockwise order may activate their factories that fall within the area of focus you determined to produce raw materials, convert raw materials into finished goods, or sell finished goods on the market.

Money is needed throughout the game, but being the best at growing your corporation in the right places and at the right time will win the game.  Three scoring rounds occur twice during the game and once at the end.  The victory conditions change after each scoring (and possibly also by players) and are determined by a Victory Conditions card.  The player with the most victory points at the end is the winner.

The game is simple - to be the winner you must 'out-score' and 'out-word' your opponent. 
Take turns to place a tile onto the board and begin building words to add to your score.
The longer the word is the bigger your score gets. 
Guaranteed endless fun for all the family; take on this challenge and discover the unlimited potential of HexaGram!
It's time to go head to head against family and friends in this classic game of strategy and vocabulary, designed to discover words on a 'whole new level'...

—description from the designer

OPPIDUM is a Tactical level skirmish board wargame that takes place during the 50s BC, when Julius Caesar successively attacked the various Celtic and Germanic peoples in Western Europe and (future Great) Britain.

The game uses the concepts and scale of the Cry Havoc series. The different scenarios will allow you to simulate ambushes, attempts by the defenders of Alesia to break the siege or the landing of Roman legionnaires on a Britannia beach defended by warriors on chariots.

—description from the publisher

A fast and brutal skirmish system, designed around quick and engaging gameplay.

Brethren is designed to be Fast, Fun and Ferocious.

The rules have been designed in a way to allow wargaming on a tight schedule. Like many others I struggle to get opponents and games in while juggling everything else in life.

Through playtesting the True Skirmish Mode (smallest iteration) can be played within half an hour and the Big Army Mode lasts the typical amount of time as other major games.

—description from the publisher

There is a free downloadable PDF of the Quick Start Guide on the Rules page of the website.

Gold n' Grog is a press your luck pirate card game where players aim to collect as much treasure as they possibly can. Use Action Cards to aid your drawing power or to hinder your opponents.

Gold n' Grog can be learned in less than 5 minutes.
To setup, all you need to do is pass out 1 cutlass card to each player, then mix the rest of the cards into a large face-down pile in the center of the table.

Turns are made up of 2 phases.


    Action Phase
    Draw Phase


During your Action Phase, you may play as many action cards from your hand as your pirate heart desires. For you draw phase, you may draw up to 5 cards from the draw pile, one at a time. If you find yourself without a cutlass and you run into something bad, you'll lose your draw, otherwise you may collect all the drawn cards.

—description from the designer

Lebanon is a country with a rich history and a bright future, but with today's rampant corruption, we need a reset. A Game of Corruption takes you back in time to Lebanon’s golden years and gives you a chance to fix what went wrong and change the course of history.

Each player is randomly and secretly assigned a role, either Reformist or Corrupt Elite, and then works on campaigning in the different districts to amass the most seats in the parliament.  On your turn, you can either swap districts with other players, draw or replace a new secret objective, or spread influence by campaigning in swing districts or by battling against other players to take their districts. The game moves into the second phase of electing a president once 5 rounds are played or 6 objectives are completed. Would the corrupt succeed in sowing confusion and distrust and bluff their way to power? Or would the reformists be able to see through their game and vote them out?

The game of corruption is tricky and treacherous. Do you have what it takes to get to the presidential chair?

Mentioned in:

https://www.gp.se/nyheter/v%C3%A4rlden/de-spelar-om-libanons-framtid-1.105402900

—description from the publisher

Cards Game, set in the cultivation of Marijuana, compete with friends to show who is the most skilled grower.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Juego de Mesa de Cartas, ambientado en el cultivo de Marihuana, compite con amigos para demostrar quien es el cultivador más habilidoso.

—description from the publisher

Unite with your brothers in arms for this holy war. Richard Lionheart and the Angevine have joined with knights from The Holy Roman Empire to try and conquer the city of Jerusalem and retake the holy land from Saladin’s Ayyubid dynasty and the Turkomans.

Fight for control over the cities and deserts of Palestine. Plan out your actions alongside your ally before turning against them and take the victory for yourself. Send out cavalry and siege engines to battle your enemies, but be aware of their need for water. You don’t want your army to die of thirst before they even clash with the enemy.

—description from the publisher

In Kartini - From Darkness to Light, you manage schools for girls where girls from different islands of Indonesia come to be students. As they graduate, the students become politicians, fighters, patrons or teachers, further advancing education for women and supporting the fight for the nation’s freedom. Strategically manage your duits (money) and books to help as many girls graduate from your school while paying attention to your school’s reputation. After three rounds, the player with the highest points wins the game.

Kartini - From Darkness to Light celebrates the triumphs of girls’ education. The game takes place in Indonesia in the late 1800 to the early 1900, during the country’s struggle for independence from Dutch colonialism. This was the era where Indonesian young women were stepping up to the plate, leading battles and participating in politics for a free Indonesia. Realizing that the key to the nation’s eventual liberation lied in education, some of them built schools and advocated for more and more girls to be educated to then participate in the nation’s fight for freedom. Indonesian women’s yearning for education and to take an active role in the public life were encapsulated in a famous series of letters written by Kartini, a Javanese aristocrat, to her Dutch friends. These letters were later published as a book titled ‘From Darkness to Light’ from which the name of this game derived. Kartini’s letters are often credited as one of the cornerstones of Indonesian women emancipation movement and they served as profound inspirations for Indonesia’s fight for independence.

—description from the publisher

Additionally,  there is also a 'Curriculum Guide' available:

Linn and Leo from the well-known and popular true crime podcast "Mord auf Ex" guide you through this true case from 1840. Together with the players, they try to solve the murder of Lord Russell.

echoes: Mord auf Ex is a co-operative audio mystery game. Using the free Ravensburger echoes app, players will hear mysterious noises and voices associated with the card themes. Together they put the 24 parts of the story in the right order to solve the case.

-description from publisher's website

The newest editions of the Novice Novice ("Nobi Nobi") TRPG series are Sword and Magic. The Sword set focuses on characters that fight with their hands or weapons, such as Warrior, Thief, Samurai and Martial Artist, but a with a few more unique additions like Baker.

Novice Novice TRPG Sword may be played by itself, or integrated with Magic for a more exciting Sword and Sorcery themed Fantasy RPG. It's also possible to integrate with other games in the Nobi Nobi series.

Compared to the previous iteration of the game, Steampunk, there are no new mechanics, but the box has been made smaller for more ease of portability.

Fighters of Europe is a fast-paced and simple tactical warfare game of air battles during WWII in the sky over Britain in 1940. Relive the fury of air combat over Europe during World War II as you direct each airplane in multiple fighter and bomber squadrons to lead attacks on the enemy's airfields, manufacturing locations, and other ground objectives.

Fighters of Europe is scenario-driven. The base game comes with ten different scenarios. With practice, you will be able to set up your own scenarios very quickly.

Move each airplane individually on a hex grid. When you maneuver to get an enemy airplane in your sights, it must try to dodge or else take damage. Some airplanes can use bombs to destroy ground installations. Stay in formation to keep the initiative and dominate your opponent. Each airplane has its own attributes in terms of speed, armor, and special abilities. Each piece is illustrated as close as possible to its historical model to maximize your immersion!
 
The base game contains a large modular board, player aids, and all the tokens you will need to play. This includes several squadrons of Hurricanes and Spitfires as well as Messerschmidt Bf109, Heinkel 111 and Junker 88.

No dice, no rulers — only dozens of airplanes! A fast-paced and streamlined game mechanism that plunges you right into the heart of battle.

-description from publisher

"Goose Green" is a Tactical Combat Series (TCS) board-wargame covering the first land battle of the Falklands War on May 28, 1982. The outcome of this engagement was crucial for both the Argentinians and the British: The Argentinians needed to prove themselves against the professional British war machine, while the British needed a land victory to satisfy the government and the public after recently suffering naval losses. Originally intended as a raid, the clash became a full 14-hour battle resulting in a hard-fought British victory.

Goose Green covers this entire battle in turns representing 20-30 minutes each, and a map scale of 125 yards per hex. Units range from sections to platoons. Both sides fielded what was roughly a reinforced Battalion, making for a battle that made for a quick playing game with great replay value. With just a minimum of special rules, this game brings the TCS to the 1980s, where in a classic infantry confrontation, not a lot has changed since WWII.

The British player must orchestrate a fast-paced attack crossing the entire map, removing all points of Argentinian resistance, and capturing Goose Green with a minimum of losses. He must make good use of few supporting arms available (half a battery of artillery, MILAN ATGMs and light mortar and MG support) to overcome dug-in Argentinian forces that outnumber the British by 2:1.

The Argentinian player has solid troops with reasonable artillery and air support but must create a defense in depth against a better lead British force accustomed to a higher operational tempo and greater firepower. Every turn requires important decisions of when to hold the line, when to withdraw, and where to commit the few remaining reserves to delay and possibly stop the British attack.

The Argentinians do not have the motivation and training level of the British but are dug-in with the benefit of minefields, trenches, numerous heavy weapons, and AA guns to assist the defense.

Scenarios:

The Battle of Goose Green (historical deployment, 39 turns)
Burntside House and Low Pass (5 turns)
Darwin Hill (15 turns)
The Airfield and the Schoolhouse (14 turns)
Bloody Goose Green (full battle with better Argentine deployment, 40 turns)
Components:

TCS rulebook (version 4.01)
Goose Green game-specific rulebook
2 x TCS Charts & Tables
One Full Color Game Map (22"x34")
140 Counters
Zip Lock Bag

-description from the designer

Corone, a Magical Girl who got tired of being overworked at a poorly managed "black" bakery, has declared independence and established her own store. Can she run things clean, or will she just end up producing another bakery filled with oven theft, embezzlement and underpaid workers?

This is the sequel to Magical â˜† Bakery, which is built on a completely new game system built around strategic store management, competing to grow your store via the use of various card effects.

Pas Assez, French for "Not Enough", is a tarot based climbing game with a rather unique twist: instead of playing elaborate melds of cards, players try to out-rank each other with increasingly high numeric values.

The game is a climb up to see who can take the most tricks and squeeze the most Major Arcana cards out of the opponents, and thus score the most points.

—description from the designer

Korone's Magical Bakery, which earned sales and success by any means necessary, is now the number one bakery in town. But there's a problem: the part-timers working at the store don't think the manager is going to pay them properly, and they've challenged her to a magical duel, with their salaries on the line! But if the store doesn't stay open, no one gets paid at all. Can the workers prevail with victory uncertain, and their salaries at stake?

Magical Bakery - Magical Girl Rebellion is the sequel to Magical Bakery - I'm the Manager, and the third game in the Magical Bakery series, with its own unique gameplay.

One player is the manager, and the other 1-3 players play as the workers in a magical duel. The workers want to win their pay, but the manager's goal is not to pay them anything, and the manager has powerful magic conferring a significant advantage. Over the course of ten rounds, the workers and manager select magic cards, and then secretly pass them to the manager, who will then declare who won the round - but once per game, the manager can lie! If the workers catch them in a lie, they win the round, and if the workers win three rounds out of the ten, they win.

Energy Management: Tactical is a paper-based simulation of tactical air-to-air combat using the innovative TRACE-R combat system.  The system uses energy-maneuverability theory to faithfully simulate close-range dog-fighting tactics and fighter performance with relatively high accuracy.

The system eliminates the limitations of hex and counter systems by replacing them with geometric construction methods using paper and common drafting tools to allow for quick, accurate, and fluid game-play.

Each game turn represents approximately 10 seconds of flight per aircraft.  During its turn, an aircraft may make any number of individual maneuvers (called “segments”).  Each segment is tracked on the aircraft’s flight log to calculate changes in the energy state of the aircraft.  The key to victory will be in managing an aircraft’s total energy while maneuvering into attack position.

—description from the designer

La Quête du GRAaL is a push-your-luck cooperative game in which you take the role of Parcival, going on a journey to find 4 great relics.

On their turn, players flip cards one by one, trying to find certain symbols, which will allow them to push their journey further by adding cards to the common deck. They must be careful, though, not to flip 5 skull symbols or they will lose a life, thus adding another skull in the deck.

Choko is a traditional game from the Republic of the Gambia in West Africa. It’s a typical two-phase game: place pieces on the board and then move and capture. The unique aspect of Choko is a concept called “Drop Initiative.” This means that in the first phase of the game, a player may choose to switch to movement tactics until the other player chooses to switch back again to the placement phase. The drop initiative offers players a way to respond to their opponent’s initial placement and really change up the game before all the pegs have been placed. A very interesting variation on the usual jump-and-capture strategy game.

—description from the publisher

Four notorious prisoners may have escapes from London's Pentonville Prison. A selection of highly-skilled MI6 agents have been tasked with getting them back behind bars...

In Captivade, each player plays as both an escapee and an agent simultaneously. As an escapee, the objective is to avoid being caught for the duration of he game. As an agent, the objective is the re-capture the other escapees within the allotted number of weeks. You may work with your fellow agents to do this, but note that each agent believes that a different escapee was imprisoned unfairly and will wish to help them evade re-capture.

---

Played over 6-10 weeks (rounds), travel around the globe, help your allied escapee evade recapture by opponents' Agents, while also trying to track down opponents' Escapees.  You can work with other players to track down Escapees, but be careful as each Agent is secretly helping one Escapee to evade capture! Agents can only travel along sanctioned routes and must always show where they are.  Escapees travel hidden, along all routes, including flights if they can afford it, but might be seen moving and have to reveal their previous locations.

Capture all other players' Escapees before the end of the allotted number of weeks to win the game!

—description from the rulebook

Those messy little monsters are at it again! They’ve snuck into your room and messed up all your things! Now you have to clean it all up before bedtime, but the monsters are still hiding in the mess and trying to keep your room dirty!

Can you outsmart them and get your room clean before the sun goes down?

In Messy Monsters!, players work together to clean up their messy room by matching two item tiles of the same color. Hidden within the pile of clothes, toys, and books, however, are monster tiles, which undo your hard work, and sun tiles, which signal that bedtime is getting closer. If you can match all the items before the sun sets, you win!

-description from designer

Based on old "Paper-and-pencil" game, Cochechs is a racing board game where nothing is left to chance. With no dice, player move their cars using vector moves.

The game includes 8 boards printed on both sides. Player will be able to build a different circuit for every race. There are a huge number of combinations available.

The game also includes cards that give to the pilots extra speed, extra break or they can disturb the rivals.
